text: Ever seen a glitch in real life? Congrats, it’s standing in front of you.
If stupidity was an Olympic sport, you'd still come last.
The only thing you’ve ever finished is your mobile data.
You have the charm of expired toothpaste.
People don’t avoid you — they escape.
Your face could crash a website.
If I wanted to hear nonsense, I'd talk to a toaster.
The only thing you contribute is background noise.
If your life was a file, I’d delete it — permanently.
Mirror cracks every morning for a reason.
Even autocorrect can’t help your personality.
Your social skills come with a buffering icon.
Someone asked for useless facts, and you showed up.
The only upgrade you need is a factory reset.
Calling you annoying is an understatement — you’re a siren during a nap.
The cringe you radiate is strong enough to destroy me
Even a potato has more purpose in life.
You’re what happens when 'meh' becomes human.
Brain cells fear entering your skull.
You're the human equivalent of a software crash.
Silence is golden. Please try it sometime.
I’ve seen Wi-Fi signals with more consistency than you.
You're like a lag spike in a speedrun — unnecessary and painful.
Even loading bars get more respect than you.
Calling you basic is an insult to simplicity
Your life story must be a glitchy TikTok.
Your presence is the reason group chats die.
Even mosquitoes avoid you — too toxic.
You're like a sneeze that never comes — frustrating and unnecessary.
Even 'skip intro' wants to skip your entire existence.
Every conversation with you feels like an unskippable tutorial.
You're the reason aliens won't visit us.
Even your imaginary friends ghosted you.
Your childhood dreams called. They gave up
Your sense of humor came with a virus.
You inspire people… to leave the room.
If I had a dollar for every smart thing you've said, I'd still be broke.
You're so dry, the Sahara envies you.
I’d agree with you, but then we’d both be wrong
Even your shadow left out of embarrassment.
Your personality belongs in the recycle bin.
